value.title: Can Trump Pre-emptively Pardon Allies or Himself? Clemency Power, Explained
value.excerpt: The president has discussed potential pardons that could test the boundaries of his constitutional power to nullify criminal liability.

value.title: ‘This is reality’: Renown doctor in Trump hospital garage retweet refutes fake claims
value.excerpt: Dr. Jacob Keeperman never expected his tweet to blow up on social media after it got hijacked by President Donald Trump.

value.title: Trump's former campaign manager Brad Parscale said he planned to capitalize on baseless fears about mass voter fraud
value.excerpt: Trump has relentlessly spread false claims and conspiracy theories about mass voter fraud committed by Democrats.

value.title: In new interview, Mueller talks about Vietnam, but not Trump and Russia
value.excerpt: Mueller spoke to Chuck Rosenberg for the NBC News podcast The Oath. In the interview, Mueller seems more in command than when he spoke to Congress in 2019.

value.title: Trump threatens to veto defense policy bill unless Congress repeals Section 230, a safeguard for social media companies
value.excerpt: President Trump is threatening to veto a defense policy bill unless it ends protections for internet companies that shield them from being held liable for material posted by their users.

value.title: A Trump Fund-Raiser for Maya Wiley? Yes, but It’s Mary Trump
value.excerpt: Ms. Trump, the president’s niece, has written a tell-all book and opposed his re-election. Now she’s holding an online event for Ms. Wiley, who’s running for mayor of New York.

value.title: Trump backs McConnell's Republican COVID-19 relief package: Mnuchin
value.excerpt: President Donald Trump will sign coronavirus relief legislation proposed by Republican Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell, Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin told reporters on Wednesday, should the proposed package pass the U.

value.title: Trump is leaving Washington as he governed — chaotically
value.excerpt: First Read is your briefing from "Meet the Press" and the NBC Political Unit on the day's most important political stories and why they matter.

value.title: As Trump Rages, Voters in a Key County Move On: ‘I’m Not Sweating It’
value.excerpt: Pre-election tensions ran high in Bucks County, Pa. But Biden supporters there are increasingly comfortable tuning President Trump out and moving on, with an eye toward January.

value.title: Trump Threatens to Veto Defense Bill if Tech Liability Shield Stands
value.excerpt: The president is demanding the termination of the broad legal immunity that social-media companies enjoy.

value.title: While Cuban-Americans in Florida came out big for Trump, Cubans stuck in Mexico pinned their hopes on Biden
value.excerpt: "I will remain hoping for a change. I'm glad Trump is out for good, and no thanks to my family in Florida," a Cuban doctor in Mexico told Insider.

value.title: Donald Trump suggests 2024 presidential bid: 'I'll see you in four years'
value.excerpt: President makes comments to Republicans at a White House reception, where video shows dozens of people crammed together without masks

value.title: 'Damaging to our democracy': Trump election lawsuits targeted areas with large Black, Latino populations
value.excerpt: Though Trump has lost his legal battles, his targeting of counties with large Black and Latino voting numbers is damaging to democracy, experts say.

value.title: Banished from the Trump legal team, attorney Sidney Powell still finds a guest chair on Fox
value.excerpt: What Dobbs didn’t mention is that eight days earlier, Donald Trump’s re-election campaign had put out a statement dropping Powell from their legal effort to overturn the resul

value.title: The Daily 202: Ousted U.S. attorney, removed by Barr as he investigated Trump associates, lands new job
value.excerpt: During a noon meeting in a suite at the Pierre hotel in Manhattan on a Friday in June, Attorney General Bill Barr pressured Geoffrey Berman to step aside as the U.S. attorney for the Southern District of New York.

value.title: Sean Hannity says Trump should pardon himself and his family to avoid a ‘witch hunt.’ Experts say it’s not that simple.
value.excerpt: Five days after President Trump pardoned his former national security adviser Michael Flynn, Fox News host and Trump ally Sean Hannity offered a suggestion on Monday about who the president should pardon next: himself and his family.

value.title: Pennsylvania lawmaker learns of positive COVID-19 test while meeting with Trump: source
value.excerpt: A Pennsylvania state senator abruptly left a meeting with President Trump after being told he was positive for the coronavirus, a source told AP.

value.title: The Latest: Graham: Trump should attend Biden’s inauguration
value.excerpt: Lindsey Graham says he thinks President Donald Trump should attend President-elect Joe Biden’s inauguration because it would be “good for the country.”

value.title: Fact check: Graphic comparing Trump and Obama is from 2018 and contains an approval rating error
value.excerpt: In November 2020, a 2018 graphic comparing President Donald Trump and President Barack Obama “by the numbers” resurfaced on social media. The chart presents figures showing the Trump administration had outperformed the Obama administration in terms of presidential

value.title: Former top admiral alarmed by Pentagon purge says Trump still has time to do something 'really destructive'
value.excerpt: "There are some real Trump loyalists there now in charge," former Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff Adm. Mike Mullen said Sunday.

value.title: Supreme Court hears Trump bid to bar illegal immigrants from U.S. census count
value.excerpt: U.S. Supreme Court justices on Monday began hearing arguments on President Donald Trump's move to exclude illegal immigrants from the population totals used to allocate congressional districts to states,

value.title: Arizona, Wisconsin to certify election results Monday, Trump may challenge outcome
value.excerpt: President Donald Trump has challenged results in several states, but the president has faced setbacks in many of those legal battles.

value.title: Trump lashes out on Twitter as former top DHS official reasserts that election was ‘secure’
value.excerpt: Trump turned to his Twitter feed to excoriate Christopher Krebs and "60 Minutes," calling it “fake news,” and reasserting his unproven claims that the election was rigged.

value.title: Exclusive: Trump to add China's SMIC and CNOOC to defense blacklist - sources
value.excerpt: The Trump administration is poised to add China's top chipmaker SMIC and national offshore oil and gas producer CNOOC to a blacklist of alleged Chinese military companies, according to a document and sources,

value.title: 'This is propaganda': Fox News' Maria Bartiromo slammed for 'softball' Trump interview
value.excerpt: Fox News anchor Maria Bartiromo faced criticism Sunday for failing to challenge President Trump on his claims of widespread election fraud.

value.title: Fired director of U.S. cyber agency Chris Krebs explains why President Trump's claims of election interference are false
value.excerpt: Chris Krebs, a lifelong Republican, was put in charge of the agency handling election security by President Trump two years ago. When Krebs said the election was the country's most secure ever, Mr. Trump fired him.

value.title: Former Overstock.com CEO says he's funding 'a team of hackers and cybersleuths' in an attempt to prove that Trump won the presidential election
value.excerpt: Patrick Byrne, known for his eccentric behavior, has endeared himself to conservative media outlets for his far-fetched claims of voter fraud.

value.title: Deep in Trump country, Nevada's first openly gay, Latino mayor leads a blue-leaning city
value.excerpt: It just goes to show you that rural America and rural Nevada aren’t just monoliths," said Daniel Corona, mayor of West Wendover.

value.title: Trump to give first post-2020 election interview to Fox’s Maria Bartiromo Sunday
value.excerpt: Maria Bartiromo will interview President Trump on Fox Business on Sunday morning — his first since the election.

value.title: Canada blocks bulk exports of some prescription drugs in response to Trump import plan
value.excerpt: Canada on Saturday blocked bulk exports of prescription drugs if they would create a shortage at home, in response to outgoing U.S. President Donald Trump's efforts to allow imports from Canada to lower some drug prices for Americans.
